item.title: The Clever D Block Initiative
item.description: During the recent 700 MHz spectrum auction, a small frequency band known as D Block went unsold because it didn’t reach its reserve price. This is unfortunate because D Block was supposed to play a crucial role in establishing a nationwide public service network. This plan, which could serve as a model for other initiatives, deserves further consideration, especially in challenging economic times. The idea for D Block originated after the September 11, 2001, attacks, when communication breakdowns hampered rescue efforts.
